Html:
The images of GoogleSatellite give the following message, after some moves:

"We are sorry, but we don't have imagery at this zoom level for this region."

Google don't block for simply 'viewing too much' so there is clearly something that caused them to block.
'viewing too much' - it's exactly what they Do :}

On one of my old project I notice that same problem. It looks that it google tile server test several things. If you load directly tiles it start block your ip with wery small ammount of tiles. But if you first create normal browser session and take all data from it to headers then it looks give more tiles. I think it is some kind smart fetch detector what give points different kind parameters and that whay detect fetchers.
